User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Event Reporter application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity, matching Firebase Auth UID.

role.description: The user's role, used for authorization.

Report.title: Report
Report.description: Represents an event report created by a user.

uid.description: The ID of the user who created the report, matching their Firebase Auth UID.

category.description: The category slug of the report.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the report was created.

formData.description: The structured data from the report form.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. Only the user with the matching `userId` can read or write their own document. This ensures user data privacy.
Stores individual reports. Authorization is content-based: only the user whose `uid` matches the document's `uid` field can perform operations. This isolates each user's reports.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure enforces strict user ownership of data. The `/users/{userId}` path uses path-based security, allowing users to manage only their own profile. The `/reports/{reportId}` collection uses content-based security, where a `uid` field inside each report document ensures that only the report's creator can access or modify it. Listing reports is also restricted, requiring a query that filters by the authenticated user's `uid`, preventing data leakage between users.
